meanings.definition: An exclamation used to indicate understanding or agreement.
meanings.sent1: Gotcha! I see what you mean now.
meanings.sent3: Gotcha! You're right, I totally get it.
meanings.sent4: Her explanation was like a light bulb moment - gotcha!
meanings.sent5: When she finally explained it clearly, it was a big gotcha moment for me.

meanings.sent1: The magician's gotcha left the audience amazed.
meanings.sent2: The gotcha in the movie plot was unexpected.
meanings.sent3: The prankster's gotcha was harmless but funny.
meanings.sent4: The twist in the story was a clever gotcha.
meanings.sent5: The gotcha in the game made everyone laugh.

meanings.sent1: The police managed to gotcha the thief before he escaped.
meanings.sent2: They tried to gotcha the runaway dog in the park.
meanings.sent3: The cat swiftly gotcha the mouse in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The spider's web gotcha the unsuspecting fly.
meanings.sent5: The fisherman skillfully gotcha a big catch in the lake.

meanings.definition: To have obtained or acquired something.
meanings.sent1: I finally gotcha the book I've been looking for.
meanings.sent2: She gotcha a new job after months of searching.
meanings.sent3: He gotcha a rare coin from his collection.
meanings.sent4: The team gotcha the victory they deserved.
meanings.sent5: After years of hard work, she gotcha her dream house.
